page.title: 01Inchnadamph community.
page.content: This township is in the Parish of {Assynt}which is very sparsely popul- ated. The land is rough moorland but provides good grazing. There are few trees and very old dykes surrounding land previously cultivated. It is famous for its{geological formations so near the surface. It may be recognised by the 100 feet high limestone{Stronchrubie Crags}which border a nature reserve. Geologists, archeologists and botanists come for specimens from Universities all over Britain. There is no industry here, only farming,gamekeeping and tourism. Two large historical features are {Ardvreck Castle}(seat of{MacLeods of {Assynt)and Calda House}(locally called the{"White House").}Ruins of sheilings speckle the land. There is one hotel and a school but no shops. Many lochs and rivers provide excellent fishing.
